text: Ochrosia kilaueaensis is a rare species of flowering plant in the Plumeria, Apocynaceae. Its common names include holei and Hawaii yellowwood. It is endemic to the island of Hawaii. It has been collected only at Puuwaawaa and Kipuka Puaulu and it has not been seen since the 1940s.World Conservation Monitoring Centre 1998. Ochrosia kilaueaensis. 2010 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 14 June 2011. It is possibly extinct.Ochrosia kilaueaensis. The Nature Conservancy. ==References== ==External links== *USDA Plants Profile Category:Trees of Hawaii Category:Endemic flora of Hawaii kilaueaensis Category:Critically endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
